subject: Web3
title: Environmental Impact Reporting
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Environmental Impact Reporting.

hook.text: Companies self-report their environmental impact. Without verification, the numbers are often misleading.

buildup.text: ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) reporting relies on trust. Companies have incentives to exaggerate progress.

discovery.text: Blockchain-verified reporting would timestamp and immutably record environmental data from IoT sensors and meters.

twist.text: Mandatory blockchain ESG reporting faces pushback. Companies prefer the flexibility of self-reported, unverified data.

climax.text: When environmental claims are verifiable on-chain, greenwashing becomes a provably false statement, not just spin.

punchline.text: Blockchain turns environmental claims from promises into provable facts.

quiz.question: Why do companies resist blockchain-based ESG reporting?
options: They prefer the flexibility of self-reported, unverified data
